pages.text: $(#630000)Elaborating on the $(l:threat/enhanced_mobs)Enhanced Mobs$()$(#630000), they appear to be far more astute (and hold a grudge) than other mobs in terms of finding hidden parasites. Through trial, running away, and observing how they interact with the other parasites, I've determined what sets them off:

$(#630000)- Attacking them in any way, shape, or form appears to notify them instantly.$(br)- Obviously, being near them without hiding will clue them in rather easily. I ought to hide when I can.$(br)- Holding Factories is another dead giveaway, only I can hold those safely.$(br)- Getting too close. I suspect this has something to do with me passively applying Call of The Hive to nearby mobs.
$(#630000)Moreover, if they learned I was a parasite in the past, they will NEVER forget. They make a special sound when they find out.

$(#630000)Specifically to spite me I assume, Enhanced Mobs will notify other nearby Enhanced Mobs of my poorly-kept secret. Even the 'passive' ones will do this, so I cannot afford to leave any that discover me alive.
